chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof starting with "```coq
", ending with "Qed.```", without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Proof:
```coq
simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

```coq
intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Solve This Proof State:

Hypotheses:
X: Type
Y: Type

Goal:
enumerable__T X -> enumerable__T Y -> enumerable__T (X + Y)

Premises:
enumerable__T = fun X : Type => exists f : nat -> option X, forall x : X, exists n : nat, f n = Some x : Type -> Prop Arguments enumerable__T _%type_scope
enumerable__T_prod : forall X Y : Type, enumerable__T X -> enumerable__T Y -> enumerable__T (X * Y)
discrete_sum : forall X Y : Type, Dis X -> Dis Y -> Dis (X + Y)
enum_enumT : forall X : Type, enumerable__T X < -> inhabited (enumT X)
prod_enumerable : forall X Y : Type, enumT X -> enumT Y -> enumT (X * Y)
enumerable_enumerable_T : forall X : Type, enumerable (fun _ : X => True) < -> enumerable__T X
enumerable_nat_nat = ex_intro (fun f : nat -> option (nat * nat) => forall x : nat * nat, exists n : nat, f n = Some x) R_nat_nat pairs_retract : enumerable__T (nat * nat)
count_nat = ex_intro (fun f : nat -> option nat => forall x : nat, exists n : nat, f n = Some x) Some (fun n : nat => ex_intro (fun n0 : nat => Some n0 = Some n) n eq_refl) : enumerable__T nat
Dis = fun X : Type => Dec2 eq : Type -> Type Arguments Dis _%type_scope
enumerable = fun (X : Type) (p : X -> Prop) => exists f : nat -> option X, forall x : X, p x < -> (exists n : nat, f n = Some x) : forall X : Type, (X -> Prop) -> Prop Arguments enumerable {X}%type_scope _%function_scope
enum = fun (X : Type) (p : X -> Prop) (L : nat -> list X) => cumulative L /\ (forall x : X, p x <-> (exists m : nat, x ∈ L m)) : forall X : Type, (X -> Prop) -> (nat -> list X) -> Prop Arguments enum {X}%type_scope (_ _)%function_scope
seteq = fun (X : Type) (A B : list X) => A ⊆ B /\ B ⊆ A : forall X : Type, list X -> list X -> Prop Arguments seteq {X}%type_scope (_ _)%list_scope
enumerable_enum : forall (X : Type) (p : X -> Prop), (exists L : nat -> list X, enum p L) < -> enumerable p
eq_dec = fun (X : Type) (Dis : Dis X) => Dis : forall X : Type, Dis X -> Dec2 eq Arguments eq_dec {X}%type_scope {Dis}
Build_enumT : forall (X : Type) (L_T : nat -> list X), cumulative L_T -> (forall x : X, exists m : nat, x ∈ L_T m) -> enumT X
strict_incl = fun (X : Type) (A B : list X) => A ⊆ B /\ (exists x : X, x ∈ B /\ ~ x ∈ A) : forall X : Type, list X -> list X -> Prop Arguments strict_incl {X}%type_scope (_ _)%list_scope
Relation_Definitions.relation = fun A : Type => A -> A -> Prop : Type -> Type Arguments Relation_Definitions.relation _%type_scope
Inductive sum (A B : Type) : Type := inl : A -> A + B | inr : B -> A + B Arguments sum (_ _)%type_scope Arguments inl {A B}%type_scope, [A] _ _ Arguments inr {A B}%type_scope, _ [B] _
cumulative = fun (X : Type) (L : nat -> list X) => forall n : nat, exists A : list X, L (S n) = L n ++ A : forall X : Type, (nat -> list X) -> Prop Arguments cumulative {X}%type_scope _%function_scope
Tauto.clause = fun Term' Annot : Type => list (Term' * Annot) : Type -> Type -> Type Arguments Tauto.clause (_ _)%type_scope
wf_strict_incl : forall X : Type, Dis X -> well_founded strict_incl
ssrbool.classically = fun P : Type => forall b : bool, (P -> is_true b) -> is_true b : Type -> Prop Arguments ssrbool.classically _%type_scope
Tauto.BFormula = fun A : Type => Tauto.GFormula : Type -> Type Arguments Tauto.BFormula _%type_scope
Relation_Operators.le_AsB_sind : forall (A B : Type) (leA : A -> A -> Prop) (leB : B -> B -> Prop) (P : A + B -> A + B -> SProp), (forall x y : A, leA x y -> P (inl x) (inl y)) -> (forall (x : A) (y : B), P (inl x) (inr y)) -> (forall x y : B, leB x y -> P (inr x) (inr y)) -> forall s s0 : A + B, Relation_Operators.le_AsB A B leA leB s s0 -> P s s0
Relation_Operators.le_AsB_ind : forall (A B : Type) (leA : A -> A -> Prop) (leB : B -> B -> Prop) (P : A + B -> A + B -> Prop), (forall x y : A, leA x y -> P (inl x) (inl y)) -> (forall (x : A) (y : B), P (inl x) (inr y)) -> (forall x y : B, leB x y -> P (inr x) (inr y)) -> forall s s0 : A + B, Relation_Operators.le_AsB A B leA leB s s0 -> P s s0
Tauto.radd_term : forall Term' Annot : Type, (Term' -> bool) -> (Term' -> Term' -> option Term') -> Term' * Annot -> Tauto.clause Term' Annot -> Tauto.clause Term' Annot + list Annot
Tauto.ror_clause : forall Term' Annot : Type, (Term' -> bool) -> (Term' -> Term' -> option Term') -> list (Term' * Annot) -> Tauto.clause Term' Annot -> Tauto.clause Term' Annot + list Annot
sumbool_rec : forall (A B : Prop) (P : {A} + {B} -> Set), (forall a : A, P (left a)) -> (forall b : B, P (right b)) -> forall s : {A} + {B}, P s
sum_ind : forall (A B : Type) (P : A + B -> Prop), (forall a : A, P (inl a)) -> (forall b : B, P (inr b)) -> forall s : A + B, P s
sum_rec : forall (A B : Type) (P : A + B -> Set), (forall a : A, P (inl a)) -> (forall b : B, P (inr b)) -> forall s : A + B, P s
sum_rect : forall (A B : Type) (P : A + B -> Type), (forall a : A, P (inl a)) -> (forall b : B, P (inr b)) -> forall s : A + B, P s
